We must ensure that what happened on January 6th ever happens again. We do that by holding our elected officials accountable and answering to the American people. That is what democracy is about.

2 years ago, I watched in horror as our democracy was attacked from its own citizens. Through perseverance and steadfast leadership, we pushed back from the edge of chaos to reaffirm our commitment to democracy.

As we mark the 2 year anniversary of this dark day in our history, let us remember the importance of protecting & defending our democracy & our Republic. 

Protecting our democracy means protecting our nation, and I'm committed to ensuring the will of the people is always upheld.
These efforts pose a significant threat to the stability and integrity of our nation, and it is incumbent upon all of us to work together to counter them.

However, the threat to our democracy did not end on January 6. 

In the two years since the attack, we have seen conspiracy theories and disinformation campaigns aimed at sowing division and undermining the legitimacy of representative government.

It is a testament to the resilience of our democracy that, despite this attack, the will of the people was upheld, and the peaceful transition of power was completed. 

Our democracy and our Republic are too important, and this attack reminded us just how fragile they can be.

January 6 was a tragic day in our nation‚Äôs history, and it‚Äôs one that has never been witnessed before. 

It is essential that we reflect on the events of that day and the impact they had on our nation, as those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it.

üßµ Two years ago, our Capitol was assaulted by those seeking to overturn the will of the people. 

It was a blatantly illegal attempt to subvert our elections and prevent the peaceful transfer of power, which is a cornerstone of our democracy.

Our democracy is resilient and has endured through many rough times. However, as we remember the horrific attack two years ago, we must remain on guard against any threat, big or small, that seeks to undermine it.

While Jan 6 was the most violent example of MAGA extremists trying to subvert our democracy, it was far from the only one in the past two years. Still today, Republicans are actively trying to undermine the right to vote and spreading disinformation to destabilize our elections.

Every day we must choose to stand up for our democracy ‚Äì like the dedicated Capitol staff and police officers, including the late Brian Sicknick ‚Äì did that day. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1611420811080110082/img/6GMRZ_chOD53OQVs.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1611420811080110082/vid/480x270/sN1MijZVlSkzXdXQ.mp4?tag=16

Two years later, I stand with gratitude in my heart for a democracy that has survived. And I stand with an absolute commitment to protecting our democracy by ensuring full accountability for all those involved in the Jan 6th assault, so that this never happens again.

Even in the past 3 days, the chaos in the House Chamber as Republicans have been unable to elect a Speaker is another attack on the institutions of our democracy, enabled and encouraged for six years by Republicans who refused to push back on Trump and extreme MAGA Republicans.

Their work exposed how the former President almost destroyed the country he swore an oath to by refusing to accept the results of a free and fair election. Now, Donald Trump must be held accountable in a court of law.

Thanks to the meticulous work of the @January6thCmte and the DOJ, we are beginning to hold those responsible for Jan 6th accountable. The Committee‚Äôs bipartisan investigations turned up disturbing details and painted a clear picture of how close we came to losing our democracy.

The violence we saw did not end that day. It's reverberated in communities across our country, as the MAGA cult has continued to inflame political tensions and violence. I saw it firsthand, as a man with a gun showed up at my doorstep shouting racist and xenophobic profanities.

I also remember seeing brave Capitol Police and D.C. Metropolitan Police officers fight to protect us from the violent mob. Some lost their lives, leaving behind spouses and children & loved ones. The sacrifices they made, putting their lives on the line, will never be forgotten.

When the House Floor was cleared on January 6th, about 30 of us were left behind, trapped in the gallery. I remember each moment vividly. I remember the pounding on the doors. I remember hearing the gunshot ring out And I remember not knowing if I would make it out alive.
